  • Method Details

    • handleLoginType

      public void handleLoginType(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws IOException
      This method handles redirection from the login type page to either the employee login page or client login page
      Throws:
      IOException - if FXMLLoader can't get or load the required fxml file

    • returnToLoginType

      public void returnToLoginType() throws IOException
      This method serves to return the GUI to the login type screen
      Throws:
      IOException - if FXMLLoader can't get and load the correct fxml file

    • handleClientLogin

      public void handleClientLogin(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws IOException
      This method handles pulling the token from the input field and submitting it for validation, and forwarding the user if their credentials are valid
      Parameters:
      e - is the ActionEvent generated by the GUI once a button is called
      Throws:
      IOException

    • clientLogin

      public boolean clientLogin(String token)
      This method checks whether the client's token was valid or not
      Parameters:
      token - the token that allows the client to log in to the application
      Returns:
      It returns true if the client credential is right otherwise it returns false

    • employeeLogin

      public boolean employeeLogin(String email, String password)
      This method checks whether the employee's credentials are valid
      Parameters:
      email - the email that allows the employee to log in to the application
      password - the password that allows the employee to log in to the application
      Returns:
      It returns true if the employee credentials is right otherwise it returns false
